      • toClassFile

        public static java.lang.String toClassFile(java.lang.String className)
        Converts class name to a file path with .class file extension.
        Parameters:
        className - string containing the class name
        Returns:
        string holding the result (as above)

      • getOpcode

        public static java.lang.String getOpcode(int op)
        ASM specific - returns the string version of the opcode. Very useful for the different return opcodes that exist, so you could just do .contains("RETURN") and be done with it. Does not support all opcodes in Java, only ones supported in the ASM library (that actually gets assigned an opcode).
        Parameters:
        op - the opcode in integer form.
        Returns:
        the string version of the given opcode.

      • concat

        public static <T> T[] concat(T[] first,
             T[] second)
        Found this from StackOverflow & also MCP too. Combines 2 arrays basically.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type
        Parameters:
        first - first array
        second - second array
        Returns:
        the merged array.

      • getClassArray

        public static java.lang.Class<?>[] getClassArray(java.lang.Object[] args)
        Creates a class array from an given object array.
        Parameters:
        args - The object array.
        Returns:
        The class array.

      • getClassFromType

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getClassFromType(java.lang.reflect.Type arg)
        Gets the initialized class name from a type. This is meant to convert primitive types into initialized version of those types.
        Parameters:
        arg - The primitive type.
        Returns:
        The initialized class.
